info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 17 at 2:31PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHWESTERN WESTMORELAND COUNTY THROUGH 300 PM EDT... At 230 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near New Stanton, or near Jeannette, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Greensburg, Jeannette, Irwin, Manor, Youngwood, New Stanton, Calumet-Norvelt, Penn, Madison, Arona, Hunker, Adamsburg, Grapeville, Crabtree, and Herminie. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 51 and 57. Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 67 and 78. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
